Legal_Issue: Whether the Registrar erred in maintaining the trademark 'Jamesway' despite alleged non-use
Evidence_Assessment: Sufficient indications of use and special circumstances justifying non-use
Burden_of_Proof: On appellant to show non-use; respondent provided evidence of use and justification
Credibility_Factor: Affidavits and invoices submitted by both parties were considered credible
Legal_Rule: Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act requires use or special circumstances to maintain registration
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, as applicable to administrative decisions
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with s. 45 notice and evidentiary requirements
Review_Standard: Assessment of sufficiency of evidence and application of s. 45
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Proper procedure followed: notice issued, affidavits submitted, fair review conducted
Key_Evidence_Considered: Invoices showing use, affidavits regarding reorganization
Legal_Framework: Administrative process under the Trade-marks Act, s. 45
Applicant_Challenge: Meredith & Finlayson challenged the continued registration
Defendant_Response: Reorganization justified non-use; evidence of actual use provided
Remedy_Sought: Removal of trademark from register due to non-use
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark without valid excuse
Applicable_Process: Ex parte re-examination under s. 45 following notice
Jurisdiction: Canadian Intellectual Property Office, Federal jurisdiction
